name: Path T Fallopian Tube
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and extension information on the primary tumor are available, use the extension information to assign the T in preference to a statement of FIGO stage - see Registrar notes.
* If the only information is (pathologic) FIGO III [NOS] or IIIC, assign the appropriate stage and leave pathologic T, N, and M blank. If the only information is FIGO stage IV, leave T and N blank and see M

**Note 2:** FIGO does not include an in situ category for tumors of the fallopian tube, but TNM does. Assign pTis (behavior code /2) for in situ cases. 

**Note 3:**  Liver capsule metastasis is T3/Stage III, liver parenchymal metastasis, M1/Stage IV. 

**Note 4:**  Both extension to and discontinuous metastasis to any of the following pelvic organs are assigned as FIGO Stage II and coded in T2a or T2b.
 * Adnexa, NOS; bladder, bladder serosa; broad ligament (mesovarium); cul de sac; contralateral fallopian tube; parametrium; pelvic peritoneum; pelvic wall; rectum; sigmoid colon; sigmoid mesentery; ureter; uterus; uterine serosa

**Note 5:**  Both extension to and discontinuous metastasis to any of the following abdominal organs are classified as FIGO Stage III and coded in T3.
* Abdominal mesentery; diaphragm; gallbladder; infracolic omentum; kidneys; large intestine except rectum and sigmoid colon; liver (peritoneal surface); omentum; pancreas; pericolic gutter; peritoneum, NOS; small intestine; spleen; stomach; ureters
rows:
Pathologic classification criteria met, evaluation done:
     Physician unable to assess T
     Surgical resection of primary tumor, extension not stated
 Physician assigns cTX, no other information available to determine T

In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive
Limited to tubal mucosa

Stated as Tis

Note: T1 has subcategories of T1a, T1b and T1c. Assign T1 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Confined to fallopian tube, NOS
Localized, NOS

FIGO Stage I [NOS]

Stated as T1

Tumor limited to one tube 
WITHOUT penetrating the serosal surface

Confined to one fallopian tube 
WITHOUT penetrating serosal surface
WITHOUT ascites

FIGO Stage IA

Stated as T1a

Tumor limited to both tubes 
WITHOUT penetrating the serosal surface

Confined to both fallopian tubes 
WITHOUT penetrating serosal surface
WITHOUT ascites

FIGO Stage IB

Stated as T1b

Tumor limited to one or both tube(s)
WITH extension onto or through the tubal serosa, OR 
WITH malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings

Extension onto or through tubal serosa
Malignant ascites
Malignant peritoneal washings

FIGO Stage IC

Stated as T1c
Tumor involves one or both fallopian tube(s) with pelvic extension

Note: T2 has subcategories of T2a, T2b and T2c. Assign T2 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Pelvic extension, NOS with no malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings

FIGO Stage II [NOS]

Stated as T2 [NOS]
Extension and/or metastasis to uterus and/or ovaries

Extension or metastasis to:
    Corpus uteri
    Ovary, ipsilateral or contralateral
    Uterus, NOS
WITHOUT malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings

FIGO Stage IIA

Stated as T2a

Extension or metastasis to:
    Adjacent peritoneum
    Broad ligament, ipsilateral or contralateral
    Cul de sac (rectouterine pouch)
    Mesosalpinx, ipsilateral or contralateral
    Rectosigmoid
    Sigmoid
WITHOUT malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings

FIGO Stage IIB

Stated as T2b

Pelvic extension (2a or 2b) 
WITH malignant cells in ascites or peritoneal washings

FIGO Stage IIC

Stated as T2c

Tumor involves one or both fallopian tube(s) 
WITH peritoneal implants outside the pelvis and/or positive regional lymph nodes

Note: T3 has subcategories of T3a, T3b and T3c. Assign T3 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Peritoneal implants or metastasis outside the pelvis, size of metastasis not stated, unknown if microscopic or macroscopic:
    Omentum
    Small intestine

Further contiguous extension

Stated as T3 [NOS]
Microscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis

Microscopic peritoneal implants or metastasis:
    Omentum
    Small intestine

FIGO Stage IIIA

Stated as T3a
Macroscopic peritoneal metastasis outside the pelvis, 2 cm or less in greatest dimension

FIGO Stage IIIB 

Stated as T3b

Peritoneal metastasis, more than 2 cm in greatest dimension AND/OR 
Positive regional lymph nodes

Primary site/histology not TNM defined
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Only information is FIGO Stage III [NOS], IIIC or IV

Pathologic classification not met
Pathologic classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    Results not documented in patient record
    No surgical resection of known primary tumor (not T0) OR
    Resection insufficient for site-specific pathologic assessment
No surgical resection of primary tumor and there isn't a positive biopsy of a structure in the highest T category and highest N category
Evidence of metastatic disease (pM1), no other workup
